lines.text: I suppose that you're taking me to a fate worse than death?
How do you now it's worse than death? Have you ever died?
I'll never go on another uninhabited island. I don't care *who* lives there!

[seeing Doris Worthington in a pit]
We just caught Tarzan's mate!
Tarzan is a character in a book.
Well, maybe he got out!

[watching through binoculars]
Gracie, my gun! A bird!
What?
A bird! A bird!
O, my goodness. Here.
[hands him a live duck]
Not a duck. My gun! How can you shoot with a duck?
Well, my father used to shoot ducks. But maybe that duck wasn't loaded, eh?
The duck wasn't loaded but I'd like to bet that your father was.
Well, if he wasn't then why did the duck shoot my father because I always thought...
Quiet! Quiet! Well, I missed him. He's gone and that was a stratospheric duck and very rare.
Well, I am just as glad that you missed him because I don't like rare ducks. I like my ducks well-done.
Now, take my uncle.
*You* take your uncle.
They did.
My uncle is a hunter.
I'd rather not hear about it.
My uncle always goes out duck hunting. Now, Monday he takes four dogs, and Tuesday he takes three dogs, and Wednesday...
Gracie! Gracie, why does he take four dogs Monday and three dogs Tuesday?
Well, because the other dog won't follow him on Tuesday.
Why?
Because he shot him on Monday.
Nice work. He aims at little innocent birds and shoots dogs.
Yeah, all except one dog. His favorite dog. His name is Scram.
Your uncle's name is Scram?
Oh stop, no, the *dog's* name is Scram. You see, that saves my uncle a lot of money calling him Scram.
Because the dog's name is Scram that saves your uncle a lot of money?
For sure. You see, when he calls the dog to feed, he hollers "Scram, Scram" and the dog runs away.
Oh! My lingerie!
[as the wind blows her panties away]
It's a blessing you're not in them.
Uh, Doris, I'm not sure the sailor and the bear should be allowed to parade this deck.
Why not, when you think of the other things that parade this deck.
We'll probably starve.
Oh, we'll look after you.
Just leave everything to us.
Now *I know* we'll starve.
Oh, stop crabbing. The work is good for your liver.
Well, why I'd care? My liver never did anything for me.
See, a little work won't hurt you... for once.
Oh, I don't mind work now and then. But I don't want it to become a habit.
